ok, nevermind. i just needed some mental help is all.. next time i should FIRST try to create a LOCAL ACCOUNT.... derp ! :P

Just to help get things straight with getting it to work:

1. The desktop icon leads to an error. Don't use it.
2. Go to where it is installed, bioshock2, SP, builds, binaries, and then use "bioshock2launcher.exe" to run the game. 
3. If you get an error of a missing xlive.dll, google "games for windows" and download the client. 
4. Re-launch the game from "bioshock2launcher.exe" and it should work.
5. You need an offline, or local, account to play and BE ABLE TO SAVE. Hit the "home" key, and create a new account. Scroll down and there should be a hyperlink to create a "local account"

From there, everything should work out. The videos are reduced in quality, but like other said it is watchable. So far, running on Windows 7, on maxed settings, and no problems so far. Hope this helped, as it took me a bit before I got it.
